job_tasks.phrase: Analyze complex tickets escalated by AI systems, apply human expertise to areas where AI falls short, and then close the gap by improving the AI system
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the integration of human expertise with AI systems to improve the AI's performance, which falls under improving and maintaining software systems that incorporate AI.

job_tasks.phrase: Review AI-generated solutions and provide detailed feedback and participate in AI model fine-tuning sessions
job_tasks.justification: Participating in AI model fine-tuning sessions directly relates to the process of adapting and improving machine learning models.

job_tasks.phrase: Prototype and test new AI tools and methodologies
job_tasks.justification: Prototyping and testing new tools and methodologies, even if AI-related, is a core software development activity focused on integration and evaluation.

job_tasks.phrase: Integrate technical human expertise and AI capabilities to deliver exceptional customer support, focusing on complex issues that AI cannot yet fully resolve
job_tasks.justification: This describes the integration of AI capabilities into a support system to enhance its functionality, fitting the definition of software development and integration.

soft_skills.phrase: Taking two whole months to get up to speed; you will be expected to ramp up one several products within the first month (we are aware this is aggressive)
soft_skills.justification: The emphasis on a rapid ramp-up period and learning multiple products quickly highlights the need for adaptability and a fast learning curve.

soft_skills.phrase: Relying on your managers for help; if you are not adept at unblocking yourself, you will likely struggle in this role
soft_skills.justification: The requirement to be adept at unblocking oneself and not relying on managers points to a strong need for independent problem-solving and self-sufficiency.

profile.rationale: The job primarily focuses on software engineering tasks (1.A.1) such as integrating AI into customer resolution systems, prototyping, and improving AI systems based on human feedback. While there is mention of AI model fine-tuning (1.B.1), the core responsibility is the application and integration of AI into existing support workflows rather than deep model development or specialization. The soft skills emphasize rapid learning and self-sufficient problem-solving, typical of an engineering role. Therefore, the role is classified as an AI-Adjacent Software Engineer.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad clearly outlines responsibilities that fall into software development and integration, with a secondary focus on AI improvement. The distinction between core AI development and integration is evident. The soft skills are also clearly stated. The confidence is high, but not perfect, as the term 'fine-tuning' could imply deeper ML work, but the overall context leans towards integration.
